author: powercode
body:
Lots of errors from the help tests when running on a machine with non-US culture. It seems like the help system tests require en-US culture, so that should be enforced.

# Steps to reproduce

On a machine with 
CurrentCulture   : sv-SE
CurrentUICulture : sv-SE

```powershell
start-pspester
```

# Expected behavior

```none
Help tests should pass
```

# Actual behavior

```none
 [-] Error occurred in Describe block 85ms
      Exception: Failed to update Help for the module(s) 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Core' with UI culture(s) {sv-SE} : Unable to retrieve the HelpInfo XML file for UI culture sv-SE. Make sure
 the HelpInfoUri property in the module manifest is valid or check your network connection and then try the command again.
```

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.2.0-preview.4
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.0-preview.4-37-g07f6395d503c16431352158da5fc7f48fbd95172
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17763
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Related #3833.

We could use `$PSDefaultParameterValues = @{"Update-Help:UICulture" = "En-Us"}` in the tests.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @adityapatwardhan Is it possible to resolve the Issue?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
We could set `[CultureInfo]::CurrentCulture = "en-US"` in Build.psm1globally. @powercode Will it work for you?

@SteveL-MSFT I could push the PR but still not clear how better to fix.

comments.author: powercode
comments.body:
I don't have a strong opinion on how to solve it - either force en-US, or make the tests that are culture sensitive use `[cultureinfo]::CurrentCulture.NumberFormat`, `[cultureinfo]::CurrentCulture.DateFormat` etc.

It's probably a good idea to make sure things work as it's supposed to outside the US, but maybe it should be done explicitly, and not just by the implicit UICulture of the testrunner.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Fixing every test is probably a huge work. I suggest to fix only scenario with Start-PSPester.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Agree that long term, we should have proper tests for different cultures, but the immediate problem is enabling the tests to run on contributor's systems that aren't en-US.  cc @JamesWTruher

title: Start-PSPester does not always run with en-US culture
